SENT.plain: This paper discusses the conditions which may be associated with diffuse periventricular hypodensity on CT
Of these conditions, subacute arteriosclerotic encephalopathy (Binswanger's disease) is a common differential diagnostic consideration
This condition results from ischemic demyelination with loss of axons and astrogliosis
CT usually shows diffuse bilateral confluent hypodensities in the cerebral white matter
This is most prominent and seen earliest in the periventricular region and may extend more diffusely into the centrum semiovale
It is important to differentiate this condition from normal pressure hydrocephalus and primary nonischemic demyelinating disease (multiple sclerosis)
